p: Other techniques have been proposed to overcome these problems. Freeze-drying of emulsions minimizes oxidative degradation of ω-3 FAs by removing oxygen and operating at low temperatures but it is more costly than spray-drying and it is not suitable for industrial applications [ 89]. Encapsulation of omega-3 FAs in the lipid vesicular system on the micro- and nano-scale provides good stability but the high costs and the use of organic solvents (e.g., chloroform) made this method not sustainable [ 89, 90]. More information about the microencapsulation techniques of ω-3 fatty acids can be found in a review written by Kaushik and colleagues [ 89].
